text:
Hi Riko,
I think I have similar issue as yours.

Can you try to skip "At" during sort.
During fast check looks promising:
e.g.:
<https://api.hubapi.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts?hapikey=your_api_key&order=created>
or "-created"
yes <@U01KQPDRSJE> `created` seems to be working as expected :+1::skin-tone-3:
<@U019V2L1GP2> `      `"supportedValueTypes": ["STATIC_VALUE"],`` can help
<@U01KZJQ6VQC> i tried the same, but seems like currently there is no option in api available for the same, i tried by setting "referencedObjectType" but didn't seems to be working either

Hi guys, I am currently looking into the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/transactional_email/single-send-overview|Single Transactional Email API>. We want to send an e-mail from HubSpot but the content is created in an external platform. When we add links to the custom properties, can we track the clicks of those links? And can we see all the same reportings as a regular email?
Thanks!

Using any of the api, you can always analyse the email performance in HubSpot. this comparison give you an better idea of the same - <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/transactional_email>

<@UCH1L597V> yes i tried adding that as well! I post on HubSpot community as well if you want to follow: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/How-to-create-a-property-with-fieldtype-HubSpot-User-via-the-API/m-p/403025>
<@UCH1L597V> see above
Thanks alot <@UCH1L597V>!

Hi folks, I'm trying out the new <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning|User Provisioning Settings API> and having issues with authentication. In particular, it seems like my `hapikey` which is working well for other endpoints is not working for the users endpoint. I get a 401 unauthorized with INVALID_AUTHENTICATION. Here's an example full HTTP request and response (with my real `hapikey` replaced, of course):
Example failing API call due to authentication issues.
So glad you have this Slack!
Separately, what's the relationship between the User Provisioning API and the CRM Owners?

Hey <@U01LFH35CL9> That API doesn’t support API keys, it only supports OAuth. The team figured this API would mostly likely get used by apps that would have OAuth set up vs single company use cases which is when Api keys are mostly used.  I can ask if they would be willing to support API keys though.

Out of curiosity, are you integrating this with a homegrown user management platform or some commercial software that doesn’t yet have an integration (or something else)?
All Users can be Owners but not all Owners must be Users (you can have SFDC queues as an Owner for example)

Hi Zack, indeed I've gotten it going with OAuth — I hadn't seen how your API docs indicated what authentication methods were supported, but now that's clear. It's not the end of the world if API keys aren't supported, but it would be nice.

It's definitely on the "homegrown" side of  things — our web application is built on Django and so we've used Django's user system as a baseline. Recently we've started onboarding sales team members much more quickly and so it has become desirable to automatically set up sales accounts in HubSpot for them alongside the primary app — especially so the HubSpot owner ID wiring is all set up correctly.
We have some parts of our system transitioned to using OAuth for API work, but haven't transitioned it all yet.
Perfect, thank you Zack! That was the answer I was hoping to hear.
That makes sense. I’ll let the users team know. Appreciate you laying that all out
